Class ReadAllocation

  • java.lang.Object
    • ReadAllocation

  • public class ReadAllocation
extends java.lang.Object
    Reads from file and presents gun violence incidents to user based on filter conditions
    Version:
    6.0
    Author:
    Michael Barreiros, Harsh Patel

      • buildBST

        public static RedBlackTree<java.lang.String,States> buildBST(java.util.ArrayList<Incidents> incidents)
        Initializes the RedBLackTree with nodes as States and appropriate ArrayList of Incidents in each State ADT
        Parameters:
        incidents - ArrayList of incidents ADT
        Returns:

      • SortIncidents

        Parameters:
        state - US state location to get Incidents list from
        userLong - Longitude coordinate of users desired location
        userLat - Latitude coordinate of users desired location
        Returns:

      • filterIncidents

        public static java.util.ArrayList<Incidents> filterIncidents(java.util.ArrayList<Incidents> InRangeIncidents,
                                                             double Range)
        Filters Incidents based on Range entered by user from users location
        Parameters:
        InRangeIncidents - Array list of incidents in a certain US State
        Range - Distance from users desired location in kilometers
        Returns:
        ArrayList of incidents that fall within the range set by user

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
                 throws java.io.IOException,
                        GeocodingException
        Prompts user to enter inputs in the form of address, US State, and range which initializes the RedBlackTree and gets the ArrayList of incidents from the entered US State, and filters the list based on the range. It prints to the console all the incidents within the US State that are within the Range entered. It also shows total number killed, injured, and number of incidents within the range. Once the program terminates the information on the console is written to a text file.
        Parameters:
        args - String arguments from the user from the console
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If file being read is not found
        GeocodingException - Google Geocoding exception handling
